TextAsset.value: Do you believe in that kind of thing?
Absolutely! And ghosts too!
I certainly admit that there are things I can't explain...
It's all bunk!
I was right behind her, but... Nidia's disappeared!
She DID say Magic Club met in the library.
Where is it?
I've checked every shelf...
${slot:playerName}? Is that you? I'm in the biology section!
I'm also in the biology section...
But I don't see you at all.
Try looking at it differently.
(Differently? I don't see anything... Wait! Out of the corner of my eye. Yes!)
(It seems the Magic Club is hidden by some kind of ... mystical camouflage? It's a trick of the light... When I stand at the correct angle, I can see right through the shelf!)
Don't just stand there! C'mon!
(I wince a little as I step THROUGH the shelf. The air inside the illusion has a buzz to it... It's soft and electric.)
(Nidia is there, reading an enormous, ancient tome. It's got to be older than the school.)
(She seems focused.)
(The book is gilded. It's strange ... The cover is leathery and old, but the golden scrollwork still looks flawless, brand new.)
(Is this magic too?)
Sorry about that... I usually keep a Sanctuary spell up to keep people from distracting me.
I'm so glad you're here! At first I thought you'd come, but then I wasn't so sure! But THEN I said you're DEFINITELY coming... but THEN I gave it some more thought and --
-- I'm definitely here.
You are, aren't you? Does this mean you'll join the Magic Club?
You can't say something as cryptic as "It's my destiny to save the world" and expect me not to be curious...
Oh, well, I wasn't trying to be mysterious. I meant exactly what I said.
... Somehow that doesn't make it less mysterious.
Is that so...
... Yup, still mysterious...
Sorry... I'm just wondering where to begin.
Well... What's that book about?
It's a book of ancient prophecy!
(Just like that?!)
Er-- I see...
Do you believe in that kind of thing... ?
Absolutely! And ghosts too!
Ghosts are definitely not real!
Erk! I thought you--
They're too creepy to be real!
I don't think that's how that works.....
I certainly admit that there are things I can't explain...
Like aliens! Or the tax code!
One of those things is definitely real......
It's all bunk!
I don't believe a word of it.
I knew you'd say that.
... YOU DID?!
Dr. Tomari says the idea of destiny is ridiculous...
But HE'S always talking about permutations and variations and quantum states and maybe someone just hasn't invented the science to measure something as big...
... As all-encompassing...
... As overwhelming...
As destiny.
Well... You definitely believe in it, right? You didn't say you WANTED to save the world ...
You said you were DESTINED to save the world.
What'd you mean by that?
Well, some day ... I'll save the world.
It's been written...
There's a prophecy about you?! Wow!
Y-yeah...
What does it say?
W-well... Are you sure you want to hear this?
Of course!
The prophecy says that ... Using an ancient amulet... I'll combine with another... and we'll meld together to become... a dragon.
WHOA!
Wait, like a metaphorical dragon?
No, definitely a very literal dragon.
Anyway, the prophecy says I'll save a kingdom...
And eventually the world.
And then I'll...
Well, that part doesn't matter.
(... ?? What was she going to say?)
It's okay. No one else believes me anyway.
It's not that... It's just that ... When you said Magic Club...
I thought maybe you meant, like, card tricks and stuff.
Oh gosh no, that stuff is hard.
...... Hahahahaha!
So you really do believe in the prophecy?
You know, at first I didn't... But I had the amulet, and there was this person... And we... Combined...
(Um... What exactly does she mean by 'combined'... )
... Into a dragon.
Wait... past tense?
You've already done it?!
A few times. We defeated an evil sorceress and saved my home kingdom. So the first part of the prophecy was totally true...
Wow. WOW! This is a lot to take in.
(To have already become a dragon...
she's so experienced.)
After that we drifted apart. I kept the amulet...
I've been trying to find a new partner...
That's actually why I was in detention.
Oh?
Building that kind of partnership with a new person...
Like what I had before...
It takes a lot of work.
But I got impatient so I...
You...
I started rubbing the amulet on people. Hitting them with it. Throwing it at people. That sort of thing.
How... Forward...
I was hoping it would just... Work.
I started with people I thought were the most compatible...
but after a while I got impatient and started hitting strangers with it.
Or, um, 'attacking' them, as the Principal put it.
(That...
That's the definition of attacking... !)
It didn't really work. In the end someone reported me to Principal Dig Dug.
I don't blame them.
It was probably the wrong way to go about it.
(Definitely the wrong way!)
I've decided to stop harassing people... But now I don't know what to do.
With... THAT person... Everything just happened. It was the most natural thing in the world.
That sounds really nice.
Yeah... Sigh.
I think...
That I just got lucky the first time.
So now I'm in a tough spot. The prophecy says I have to combine with someone else to use the amulet...
So it's not like I can just do it myself. It's so hard to find the right person... I wish...
I wish...
Sigh...
To tell you the truth...
I'm not very good with people.
I always second-guess myself,
...and overthink what I'm going to say...
or I spend too long thinking about what their words mean...
Or what they might REALLY mean...
By the time I get around to saying something, the other person is usually gone...
Or thinks I'm crazy. Or I say something embarrassing in the first place, and then it's...
So awkward...
And if you do it often enough, you get a reputation.
I'm such a mess. Who'd even want to combine with me...
I wish... You'd stop saying it like that... !
(I don't think she heard me... )
Ahem.
Nidia?
Hm?
I don't think you should give up so easily.
Principal Dig Dug's exact words were "maybe you should give up more easily".
(Yikes!)
Well... Maybe I can help somehow.
Ah! AHHH!
What? What?!
I thought... I mean, I think a lot... I thought maybe you were good, or maybe you were bad,
... or maybe you were in the gray area like one of those hardened vigilantes with nothing to lose...
... But you're definitely, definitely a good person!
I have to go, but let's have a Magic Club meeting again! Really soon!
